image:image.image:caption: The Iberian Acorn Ham &quot;11 TESOROS IBÉRICOS&quot; is produced from a meticulous selection of Iberian pigs (cultivated free range) to which, after an average healing process of 42 months, give rise to a spectacular delicacy. It is characteristic for its very fine texture, unmistakable aroma, intense flavour and warmth on the palate.
image:image.image:title: Iberian Acorn Ham 75% Iberian Breed - 11 TESOROS IBÉRICOS

image:image.image:caption: The Cebo Campo Ham 50% Iberian Breed (old recebo) &quot;11 TESOROS IBÉRICOS&quot; is produced from a meticulous selection of Iberian pigs fed in the Extremadura pasture based on acorns, but their food is completed with natural feed. After an average healing process of around 42 months, they give rise to a delicacy
image:image.image:title: Cebo Campo Ham 50% Iberian Breed (Old Recebo) - 11 TESOROS IBÉRICOS

image:image.image:caption: The Iberian Acorn Shoulder 75% Iberian Breed “11 TESOROS IBÉRICOS” is made from a meticulous selection of Iberian pigs fed in the Extremadura pasture based on acorns, which after an average healing process of 30 months give rise to a spectacular delicacy. It is characteristic for its very fine texture, unmistakable aroma, intense flavour and warmth on the palate. The shoulder comes from the front limbs of the Iberian pig.
image:image.image:title: Iberian Acorn Shoulder 75% Iberian Breed - 11 TESOROS IBÉRICOS

image:image.image:caption: The Cebo Campo Shoulder 50% Iberian Breed (old recebo) “11 TESOROS IBÉRICOS” is elaborated from a meticulous selection of Iberian pigs fed in the Extremadura acorn based pasture, but their food is completed with natural feed. After an average healing process of around 30 months they give rise to a spectacular delicacy. It is characteristic for its very fine texture, unmistakable aroma, intense flavour and warmth on the palate. The shoulder comes from the front limbs of the Iberian pig.
image:image.image:title: Cebo Campo Shoulder 50% Iberian Breed (Old Recebo) - 11 TESOROS IBÉRICOS

image:image.image:caption: This piece is characterised by having a juicy texture superior to the Iberian loin of acorn, so that with an appropriate maturation process, it becomes a gastronomic jewel of incomparable quality. It is obtained from the loin head once seasoned, marinated and stuffed in gut.
image:image.image:title: Iberian Acorn Lomito - 11 TESOROS IBÉRICOS

image:image.image:caption: From the natural loin of each pig, once marinated and in non natural gut, this piece of bright colours is obtained after a slow ripening in natural dryers, which gives a marble aspect when cut due to the infiltration of fat coming from the fusion of the acorn.
image:image.image:title: Iberian Acorn Loin 75% Iberian Breed - 11 TESOROS IBÉRICOS

image:image.image:caption: From the natural tenderloin of each pig, once seasoned and in non natural gut, this piece of bright colours and differential flavour is obtained after a slow ripening in natural dryers.
image:image.image:title: Cebo Campo Loin 50% Iberian Breed (Old Recebo) - 11 TESOROS IBÉRICOS

image:image.image:caption: On the basis of lean first quality Iberian pork, seasoned with paprika, salt and natural species is obtained after a slow ripening in natural dryers this exquisite product of bright red color, intense aroma and firm texture.
image:image.image:title: Iberian Acorn Sausage - 11 TESOROS IBÉRICOS

image:image.image:caption: On the basis of the lean of Iberian pig of very good quality, seasoned and stuffed in natural gut, is obtained after a slow ripening in natural dryers, this exquisite product of whitish colour, subtle aroma and firm texture.
image:image.image:title: Iberian Acorn Highly-Seasoned Sausage - 11 TESOROS IBÉRICOS

image:image.image:caption: On the basis of Iberian pork, seasoned with paprika, oregano, salt and sugars, this exquisite product is obtained after maturing in natural dryers.
image:image.image:title: Iberian Longaniza (Sausage) - 11 TESOROS IBÉRICOS

image:image.image:caption: On the basis of the Iberian pork meat, seasoned and stuffed in natural casing, this exquisite product is obtained after maturing in natural dryers.
image:image.image:title: Iberian Longaniza (Highly-Seasoned Sausage) - 11 TESOROS IBÉRICOS

image:image.image:caption: Ripe cheese, homogeneous colour, yellowish ivory, scarce eyes, small size and evenly distributed. With a balanced taste and a persistent aftertaste.
image:image.image:title: Semicured Sheep Cheese (1/8) - REVILLA

image:image.image:caption: Ripe cheese, homogeneous colour, yellowish ivory, scarce eyes, small size and evenly distributed. With a balanced and intense taste, and a persistent aftertaste.
image:image.image:title: Cured Sheep Cheese (1/8) - REVILLA

image:image.image:caption: Rosemary Cured Sheep's Cheese of golden colour, whose flavour and aroma is due to its entirely handmade elaboration, being treated with butter and letting it dry in caves to suitable temperature, humidity and light. Its ideal ripening time (between 6 and 8 months) enhances its flavour and aroma while giving it a creamy texture giving rise to a very cured cheese with a touch of cheese in oil.
image:image.image:title: Rosemary Cured Sheep Cheese (1/8) - PASTOR VIEJO Grey Label

image:image.image:caption: Cured Sheep's Cheese of golden color, whose flavor and aroma is due to its totally handmade elaboration, being treated with butter and letting it dry in caves to suitable temperature, humidity and light. Its ideal ripening time (between 6 and 8 months) enhances its flavour and aroma while giving it a creamy texture giving rise to a very cured cheese with a touch of cheese in oil.
image:image.image:title: Cured Sheep Cheese Aged (1/8) - PASTOR VIEJO Grey Label

image:image.image:caption: - Protected designation of origin (PDO) PRIEGO DE CÓRDOBA.- Extra Virgin Olive Oil obtained cold from the first extraction of olives exclusively by mechanical instruments.- Olives varieties: Picuda, Hojiblanca and Picual. - Cultivated within the geographical area that includes the PDO (Protected designation of origin) of PRIEGO DE CÓRDOBA.- Harvested in November and December under the control of the Regulatory Council.
